text: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Don't let the noise of others' opinions drown out your own inner voice.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Till it has loved, no man or woman can become itself.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Life is too short to waste your time on people who don't respect, appreciate, and value you.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: It is the power of thought that gives man power over nature.
author: Hans Christian Andersen

text: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
author: Herman Melville

text: Every defeat, every heartbreak every loss, contains its own seed, its own lesson on how to improve your performance the next time.
author: Og Mandino

text: Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages.
author: George Washington

text: Attitude, not aptitude, determines altitude.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: If you don't have time to do it right, when will you have time to do it over?
author: John Wooden

text: The more I want to get something done, the less I call it work.
author: Richard Bach

text: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Do not look for a sanctuary in anyone except your self.
author: Buddha

text: You must welcome change as the rule but not as your ruler.
author: Denis Waitley

text: Whatever your heart clings to and confides in, that is really your God.
author: Martin Luther

text: One of the advantages of being disorganized is that one is always having surprising discoveries.
author: A.A. Milne

text: Some people don't like change, but you need to embrace change if the alternative is disaster.
author: Elon Musk

text: Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: I take the position that I'm always to some degree wrong, and the aspiration is to be less wrong.
author: Elon Musk

text: It is what we make out of what we have, not what we are given, that separates one person from another.
author: Nelson Mandela

text: You can often change your circumstances by changing your attitude.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Happiness is a gift and the trick is not to expect it, but to delight in it when it comes.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Life doesn't get easier or more forgiving, we get stronger and more resilient.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: A real decision is measured by the fact that you've taken a new action. If there's no action, you haven't truly decided.
author: Tony Robbins

text: In the beginner's mind there are many possibilities, but in the expert's mind there are few.
author: Shunryu Suzuki

text: New opinions are always suspected, and usually opposed, without any other reason but because they are not common.
author: John Locke

text: Anyone telling you it's pointless to share your perspective is sharing their perspective.
author: Jack Butcher

text: Stuff your eyes with wonder... live as if you'd drop dead in ten seconds. See the world. It's more fantastic than any dream made or paid for in factories.
author: Ray Bradbury

text: Everything that is done in the world is done by hope.
author: Martin Luther

text: The grass is greener where you water it.
author: Neil Barringham

text: You are always your own best guru, your own best teacher, the answers are always inside you.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Poetry is written with tears, fiction with blood, and history with invisible ink.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: I will not walk backward in life.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: A leader leads by example, not by force.
author: Sun Tzu

text: If you cling to a certain thought with dynamic will power, it finally assumes a tangible outward form.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

text: Each day provides it's own gifts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

text: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
author: John Wooden

text: Your goals are the road maps that guide you and show you what is possible for your life.
author: Les Brown

text: To avoid criticism, do nothing, say nothing, and be nothing.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Each problem has a positive side.
author: Og Mandino

text: The more you give, the more comes back to you.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: If you want to feel happy, do something for yourself. If you want to feel fulfilled, do something for someone else.
author: Simon Sinek

text: Every time we liberate a woman, we liberate a man.
author: Margaret Mead

text: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
author: Alan Watts

text: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: A good master leads you to the true master within. Only that master, who is your own higher self, can adequately answer all questions.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Don't be afraid to see what you see.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: A wise man can learn more from a foolish question than a fool can learn from a wise answer.
author: Bruce Lee

text: The farther backward you can look, the farther forward you are likely to see.
author: Winston Churchill

text: He who knows best knows how little he knows.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Honor is the foundation of courage.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.
author: Euripides

text: Sometimes a change of perspective is all it takes to see the light.
author: Dan Brown

text: People spend too much time doing and not enough time thinking about what they should be doing.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: A clever person turns great troubles into little ones, and little ones into none at all.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Your neighbor is the man who needs you.
author: Elbert Hubbard

text: Night is a more quiet time to work. It aids thought.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

text: Be approximately right rather than exactly wrong.
author: John Tukey

text: You'll see it when you believe it.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: We never know how high we are till we are called to rise. Then if we are true to form our statures touch the skies.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Believe you can and you will be halfway there.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time.
author: Thomas Edison

text: You are a function of what the whole universe is doing in the same way that a wave is a function of what the whole ocean is doing.
author: Alan Watts

text: In nature there is no alienation. Everything belongs.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Life is ours to be spent, not to be saved.
author: D. H. Lawrence

text: The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Our greatest fears lie in anticipation.
author: Honore de Balzac

text: Know the rules well, so you can break them effectively.
author: Dalai Lama

text: Vision is the art of seeing things invisible.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: A needle is not sharp at both ends.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: As mortals, we're ruled by conditions, not by ourselves.
author: Bodhidharma

text: Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: It doesn't matter if the glass is half empty or half full. Be grateful you have a glass - you're the only person that can decide what's in it.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Courage is the willingness to engage in a risk-taking behavior regardless of whether the consequences are unknown or possibly adverse.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear - not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

text: I thought how unpleasant it is to be locked out; and I thought how it is worse, perhaps, to be locked in.
author: Virginia Woolf

text: The wisdom of life consists in the elimination of the nonessentials.
author: Lin Yutang

text: Don't be afraid to go slowly. Be afraid of stopping.
author: Zen Proverb

text: Be confident, not certain.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Successful people are not without problems. They're simply people who've learned to solve their problems.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: Catch, then, O catch the transient hour; Improve each moment as it flies!
author: St. Jerome

text: If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Mastery is not a function of genius or talent, it is a function of time and intense focus applied to a particular field of knowledge.
author: Robert Greene

text: Never lose hope. Storms make people stronger and never last forever.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: What we call the beginning is often the end. And to make an end is to make a beginning. The end is where we start from.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Too many of us are not living our dreams because we are living our fears.
author: Les Brown

text: A wise man makes his own decisions, but an ignorant man mindlessly follows the crowd.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Observe things as they are and don't pay attention to other people.
author: Huang Po

text: Your happiness is what truly matters most. Do what you have to do in order to be happy.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Life without love is like a tree without blossoms or fruit.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
author: Brian Tracy

text: We know nothing of tomorrow, our business is to be good and happy today.
author: Sydney Smith

text: The price of inaction is far greater than the cost of making a mistake.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Success and failure come and go, but don't let them define you. It's who you are that matters.
author: Kamal Ravikant

text: Cease striving. Then there will be transformation.
author: Zhuangzi

text: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
author: Elon Musk

text: Many a man has failed because he had his wishbone where his backbone should have been.
author: Ronald Reagan

text: Better the cottage where one is merry than the palace where one weeps.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: The most tragic thing in the world is a man of genius who is not a man of honor.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: It's better to dance than to march through life.
author: Yoko Ono

text: Success does not consist in never making mistakes but in never making the same one a second time.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: The only real mistake is the one from which we learn nothing.
author: Henry Ford

text: Everyone must choose one of two pains: The pain of discipline or the pain of regret.
author: Jim Rohn

text: How people treat you is their karma; how you react is yours.
author: Wayne Dyer

text: The dreamers are the saviors of the worlds.
author: James Allen

text: No kind action ever stops with itself. One kind action leads to another. Good example is followed.
author: Amelia Earhart

text: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Longevity is a fleeting moment that lasts forever.
author: Vidal Sassoon

text: Genius is one percent inspiration and ninety-nine percent perspiration.
author: Thomas Edison

text: Start the day with love, spend the day with love, fill the day with love and end the day with love.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Thinking is difficult, that's why most people judge.
author: Carl Jung

text: Forever is composed of now's.
author: Emily Dickinson

text: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: The most important things are the hardest to say.
author: Stephen King

text: an action committed in anger is an action doomed to failure.
author: Genghis Khan

text: Those who realize their folly are not true fools.
author: Zhuangzi

text: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.
author: Ralph Marston

text: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: It isn't what you have or who you are or where you are or what you are doing that makes you happy or unhappy. It is what you think about it.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Even if you stumble and fall down, it doesn't mean you've chosen the wrong path.
author: Zen Proverb

text: There is no one giant step that does it. It's a lot of little steps.
author: Peter A. Cohen

text: Friendship takes time and energy if it's going to work.
author: Betty White

text: Don't look back ? you're not going that way.
author: Mary Engelbreit

text: The consequences of today are determined by the actions of the past. To change your future, alter your decisions today.
author: Unknown

text: Ask no questions, and you'll be told no lies.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T.S. Eliot

text: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.
author: Dale Carnegie

text: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
author: Lao Tzu

text: Don't let the silly little dramas of each day get you down. For you are here to do great things.
author: Ralph Marston

text: If you love life, don't waste time, for time is what life is made up of.
author: Bruce Lee

text: We are all here for some special reason.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The wise accomplish all that they want without arousing the envy or scorn of others.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: Surround yourself with only people who are going to lift you higher.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: The wiser you get, the less you care to look like a fool.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: A thing must be loved before it is lovable.
author: Gilbert Chesterton

text: No matter how tall the mountain is, it cannot block the sun.
author: Chinese Proverb

text: Life is just the same as learning to swim. Do not be afraid of making mistakes, for there is no other way of learning how to live!
author: Alfred Adler

text: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
author: Steve Jobs

text: Focus is a matter of deciding what things you're not going to do.
author: John Carmack

text: No man is happy who does not think himself so.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: It is our choices that show what we truly are, far more than our abilities.
author: Albus Dumbledore

text: Every day is lost in which we do not learn something useful. Man has no nobler or more valuable possession than time.
author: Thomas Jefferson

text: Never close your lips to those whom you have already opened your heart.
author: Charles Dickens

text: You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.
author: Les Brown

text: Life can be the scariest and most beautiful thing simultaneously.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.
author: Thich Nhat Hanh

text: It is difficult to free fools from the chains they revere.
author: Voltaire

text: You can only lose something that you have, but you cannot lose something that you are.
author: Eckhart Tolle

text: Life is a gift. Never forget to enjoy and bask in every moment you are in.
author: Celestine Chua

text: Only to the extent that we expose ourselves over and over to annihilation can that which is indestructible in us be found.
author: Pema Chodron

text: Life is about accepting the challenges along the way, choosing to keep moving forward, and savoring the journey.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Courage Is a Love Affair with the Unknown
author: Osho

text: Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.
author: Alfred Adler

text: Do good by stealth, and blush to find it fame.
author: Alexander Pope

text: The score never interested me, only the game.
author: Mae West

text: Freedom lies in being bold.
author: Robert Frost

text: Scared people want comfort and certainty so they avoid failure. People living fully seek challenges because this is where they feel alive.
author: Maxime Lagace

text: The successful warrior is the average man, with laser-like focus.
author: Bruce Lee

text: You have the ability, now apply yourself.
author: Benjamin Mays

text: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
author: Walt Whitman

text: Don't let anyone define you. You define yourself.
author: Billie Jean King

text: The mirror is a worthless invention. The only way to truly see yourself is in the reflection of someone elses. eyes.
author: Voltaire

text: I live by letting things happen.
author: Dogen

text: Your imagination is your preview of life's coming attractions.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The world makes way for the man who knows where he is going.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The idea of ourselves is our escape from the fact of what we really are.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

text: A fear-oriented man is always calculating, planning, arranging, safeguarding. His whole life is lost in this way.
author: Osho

text: Failure is a prerequisite for great success. If you want success faster, double your rate of failure.
author: Brian Tracy

text: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
author: St. Jerome

text: A Rolling Stone Gathers No Moss.
author: Publilius Syrus

text: There is nothing like looking if you want to find something.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

text: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
author: Lao Tzu

text: You don't have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: The day is for honest men, the night for thieves.
author: Euripides

text: Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.
author: John Eliot

text: Move out of your comfort zone. You can only grow if you are willing to feel awkward and uncomfortable when you try something new.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Conscience is a dog that does not stop us from passing but that we cannot prevent from barking.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: Always focus on the front windshield and not the rear view mirror.
author: Colin Powell

text: Growth comes at the point of resistance.
author: Josh Waitzkin

text: A lot of people have gone further than they thought they could because someone else thought they could.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Keep your friends close, and your enemies closer.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Don't wait for the right opportunity: create it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: Life is but one dream flowing into another.
author: Ming-Dao Deng

text: A man sooner or later discovers that he is the master-gardener of his soul, the director of his life.
author: James Allen

text: Judge a man by his questions rather than his answers.
author: Voltaire

text: Always do what is right. It will gratify half of mankind and astound the other.
author: Mark Twain

text: Often we pass beside happiness without seeing it, without looking at it, or even if we have seen and looked at it, without recognizing it.
author: Alexandre Dumas

text: You can have the mind or you can have the moment.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Make yourself so useful to other people, that they think you are irreplaceable.
author: Og Mandino

text: The greatest weariness comes from work not done.
author: Eric Hoffer

text: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

text: Men are equal; it is not birth but virtue that makes the difference.
author: Voltaire

text: A Quitter never wins ? and ? a Winner never quits.
author: Napoleon Hill

text: In spite of everything, I shall rise again.
author: Vincent van Gogh

text: Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.
author: Gurbaksh Chahal

text: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
author: St. Jerome

text: Blessed is he who expects nothing, for he shall be disappointed.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: Everyone has a sense of humor. If you don't laugh at jokes, you probably laugh at opinions.
author: Criss Jami

text: Investing in yourself is the best investment you will ever make.
author: Robin Sharma

text: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

text: There are three classes of people: those who see. Those who see when they are shown. Those who do not see.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Becoming a great leader doesn't mean being perfect. it means living with your imperfections.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: Men learn to love the woman they are attracted to. Women learn to become attracted to the man they fall in love with.
author: Woody Allen

text: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

text: Giving is the secret of a healthy life. Not necessarily money, but whatever a person has of encouragement, sympathy and understanding.
author: John D. Rockefeller

text: Success is getting what you want, happiness is wanting what you get.
author: W.P. Kinsella

text: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.
author: Steve Jobs

text: There is only one way to happiness and that is to cease worrying about things which are beyond the power or our will.
author: Epictetus

text: A man should never be ashamed to own that he has been in the wrong, which is but saying, that he is wiser today than yesterday.
author: Jonathan Swift

text: The two most powerful warriors are patience and time.
author: Leo Tolstoy

text: It is easy to love your friend, but sometimes the hardest lesson to learn is to love your enemy.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.
author: Steve Maraboli

text: Just because something isn't a lie does not mean that it isn't deceptive.
author: Criss Jami

text: Don't waste your time in anger, regrets, worries, and grudges. Life is too short to be unhappy.
author: Roy T. Bennett

text: Every drop in the ocean counts.
author: Yoko Ono

text: You make your own luck if you stay at it long enough.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: It doesn't matter where you are, you are nowhere compared to where you can go.
author: Bob Proctor

text: You cannot swim for new horizons until you have courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: William Faulkner

text: A man is literally what he thinks.
author: James Allen

text: Until you make the unconscious conscious, it will direct your life and you will call it fate.
author: Carl Jung

text: Happiness is a choice and a skill and you can dedicate yourself to learning that skill and making that choice.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: Be a master of change rather than a victim of change.
author: Brian Tracy

text: Throw your heart over the bar and your body will follow.
author: Norman Vincent Peale

text: Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.
author: Sathya Sai Baba

text: Presents are made for the pleasure of who gives them, not the merits of who receives them.
author: Carlos Ruiz Zafon

text: Art is the signature of civilizations.
author: Beverly Sills

text: Not all of us can do great things. But we can do small things with great love.
author: Mother Teresa

text: Constantly think about how you could be doing things better.
author: Elon Musk

text: Society is composed of two great classes those who have more dinners than appetite, and those who have more appetite than dinners.
author: Nicolas Chamfort

text: It takes a minute to have a crush on someone, an hour to like someone, and a day to love someone... but it takes a lifetime to forget someone.
author: Kahlil Gibran

text: Among the things you can give and still keep are your word, a smile, and a grateful heart.
author: Zig Ziglar

text: Passion creates, addiction consumes.
author: Gabor Mate

text: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

text: Learn to enjoy every minute of your life. Be happy now. Don't wait for something outside of yourself to make you happy in the future.
author: Earl Nightingale

text: If you're really truthful with yourself, it's a wonderful guidance.
author: Charlie Chaplin

text: Decide upon your major definite purpose in life and then organize all your activities around it.
author: Brian Tracy

text: It's not the love you make. It's the love you give.
author: Nikola Tesla

text: Trust thyself: every heart vibrates to that iron string.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

text: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
author: Dalai Lama

text: If the only prayer you ever say in your entire life is thank you, it will be enough.
author: Meister Eckhart

text: Many people spend more time looking at their failures than focusing on their successes.
author: Lolly Daskal

text: There is a wisdom of the head, and there is a wisdom of the heart.
author: Charles Dickens

text: Good entrepreneurs don't fail because they stay at it.
author: Naval Ravikant

text: The biggest challenge after success is shutting up about it.
author: Criss Jami

text: If you need inspiration, don't do it.
author: Elon Musk

text: Opportunities multiply as they are seized.
author: Sun Tzu

text: Winners never quit and quitters never win.
author: Vince Lombardi

text: Thinking is a habit, and like any other habit, it can be changed; it just takes effort and repetition.
author: John Eliot
